intro: Cyrtandra mamolea, commonly known as the Mamolea Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts in Hawaii.
